ISSUE.TITLE: [Bug] Formula LOG on MSSQL
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: LOG formula works as documented for SQLITE, MySQL, PostgreSQL. Fails for MSSQL SQLITE documentation- In the two-argument version of log(B,X), the first argument is the base and the second argument is the operand. This is the same as in PostgreSQL and MySQL, but is reversed from SQL Server which uses the second argument as the base and the first argument as the operand. **Expected behavior** NocoDB documentation indicates LOG function to be log(B,X). MSSQL, its reversed.

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: feat: add rows count in footer re #946 Signed-off-by: Pranav C <pranavxc@gmail.com>

COMMIT.MESSAGE: fix: handle LOG formula function in MSSQL same as other databases re #949 Signed-off-by: Pranav C <pranavxc@gmail.com>
